text: Hello, everyone I'm happy to be there and happy to ask for your help.  Hope I will be able to explain it clearly. I want to create an email from Scratch the design tool. And in this email I want the email being personalized with data from the customer like the product he chooses, his email, etc. I guess I should first create the email with the hubl variable and then create an automatisation with the data needed. Can someone help me and tell me which variable I should use ? here is the product module concerned attached. Sorry if my english is not clear i'm from France and trying to be the clearest possible.

Maybe I’m missing it but what is the syntax for hiding a section/row/column etc in a dnd_area for mobile or desktop?  Found lots of sentences that say you can control the visibility in DND_areas but no where can I find an example of what that looks like in the actual template code.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/mobile-breakpoint-for-themes>

Okay finally found it in the slack here.

hidden={ “default”:false, “mobile”:true }
hey, what's a good way to convert an `array of strings` into a `single comma separated string`?

I believe the classic `|join` would do the trick

```{% set test_array = ["one", "two", "three"] %}
{{ test_array|join(', ')}}```
output: `"one, two, three"`

as long as one of the strings doesn't contain a comma :supervillain:
in which case we might have to get into the <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comma-separated_values#:~:text=Simple%20CSV%20implementations,in%20Sybase%20Central).|weeds of CSV implementations>.

not trying to be too smart. just smarting from having been bitten earlier elsewhere.
